author: Joe Morgenstern
title: ‘Tully’ Review: Enter the Perfect Nanny
text:
‘Tully” turns out to be a twofer. There’s the movie you see, which is whipsmart, intimate, affecting and fearlessly funny about the mixed blessings of motherhood. And there’s the movie you replay in your mind to sort out its several mysteries. That one is richer, deeper and strangely beautiful.
The stars are Charlize Theron as Marlo, a mother who can barely cope with two kids, then gives birth to a third, and Mackenzie Davis as Tully, a night nanny who comes to help. (The unseen stars are Jason Reitman, the director, and...
